availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Matthew J. Cecil (Marion County, Kentucky, farmer and slaveholder.)

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky, native. Son of Matthew Cecil and Sarah Howard Cecil. Married to Angila Hogan Cecil. Father of Sarah E. Cecil, Charles L. Cecil, Eulalia F. Cecil, John H. Cecil, Mary V. Cecil, and Emily M. Cecil. Married to Elizabeth Cecil. Resident of Marion County in 1840. Owned two enslaved persons in Marion County in 1840. Farmer in Marion County in 1850. Owned thirteen enslaved persons in Marion County in 1850. Farmer in Marion County in 1860. Owned seventeen enslaved persons in Marion County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, p. 346.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 1, p. 487A.
